==Usage:== 
webscreenie [OPTIONS]... [<input url> [<output file>]]

Converts a html page to an image
Use without options for the graphical user interface

==Example:==
webscreenie --url http://www.example.com --file example.png --target_size 640x480

===Options:===
 * --help                 show this help / usage message
 * --url <url>            url to open
 * --file <url>           use url as output

===Image Options:===
 * --offset <WxY>         offset from upper-top to crop
 * --size <WxY>           dimension of the web page capture
 * --target_size <WxY>    target dimension of the output image

===Advanced Options:===

(Not yet implemented)

 * --script <script>      custom javascript to execute before render
 * --script_file <file>   custom javascript file to execute before render
 * --css <css>            custom CSS to change render style
 * --css_file <file>      custom CSS
 * --delay <ms>           delay, in microseconds, before render
 * --options <file>       configuration file
